The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia.

programme.title: USA Mullet Championships
programme.desc: See who sport's the best freedom flapper, modern mullet, Tennessee top hat and other styles of lenghty man locks at the 2020 Mullet Championship.

programme.title: Corgi Races
programme.desc: Corgis from throughout the Pacific Northwest will be at Emerald Downs Racetrack in Auburn, Wash., for the annual Corgi Races. There will be six heats with the top two finishers in each heat qualifying for the Championship race. Some Corgis will run fast, others not so fast, but it's guaranteed fun for all the dogs, their owners, and the fans.

programme.title: Sasquatch Uncut Beard and Mustache Competition
programme.desc: Beard and mustache growth competitions in multiple categories, from Imlay City, Mich.

programme.title: Three Rivers Waiter and Waitress Competition

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: Top mountain bike riders Kade Edwards, Matt MacDuff, Remy Morton, Dylan Stark and Tom van Steenbergen submit video for X Games medals showcasing them conquering rugged terrain and jaw-dropping jumps.

programme.title: Roofball World Championships
programme.desc: The 24th playing of the World Championships competition to determine who's the best at flinging a football at a natural gas vent. Contested at the site of Roofball's invention, Willis Park in Beaverton, Ore.

programme.title: World Dog Surfing Championships Best Waves

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: This three-part film begins as a modern cultural history of Italy, in particular the northern city of Milan, which in the early 1980s rose as a worldwide capital of fashion and commerce. At the center of that success was Silvio Berlusconi, a real estate magnate who entered the media sphere by buying local TV stations, then purchased his hometown football club, and set out to elevate it into the greatest professional team in the world.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: A new era of glory for A.C. Milan began with former player Fabio Capello taking the reins of the team and winning three consecutive Serie A titles from 1992 to 1994. As for the club's owner, when a political corruption scandal threatens to enmesh Berlusconi, he responds by running for the prime minister. The most powerful and successful man in Italian football is now the most powerful man in Italy--and yet the halo will only last so long.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Berlusconi evades more corruption allegations and trials and seems to be revived by another Scudetto for A.C. Milan in 1996. More and more, the line between football and politics is blurred, the cult of personality around the man grows even bigger, and even the most passionate A.C. Milan supporters start to struggle with the contradictions. There will be two more stints as prime minister, the controversy and turmoil seeming to grow with every year.

programme.sub-title: Game 3: Indiana Fever at Atlanta Dream

Kelsey Mitchell (23 ppg this series) and the Dream's Allisha Gray star in the backcourt.

programme.title: WNBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Seattle Storm at Las Vegas Aces
programme.desc: Seattle Storm at Las Vegas Aces in the deciding Game 3 of a first-round series. From Michelob Ultra Arena. Skylar Diggins and Nneka Ogwumike (50 points combined) led a Seattle rally from 14 points down to take Game 2 and force this return trip to Vegas, halting the Aces' 17-game winning streak in the process. Jackie Young scored 25 points in the loss.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Edmonton Oilers vs. Los Angeles Kings
programme.desc: Edmonton Oilers vs. Los Angeles Kings in Game 1 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. These Pacific foes drop the puck for a fourth straight first round clash, with Edmonton prevailing in seven games (2022), six games (2023) and five games (2024) previously. Overall, the Oilers have won eight of 10 playoff series vs. L.A., with the first seven occuring from 1982-92.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Carolina Hurricanes at Washington Capitals
programme.desc: Carolina Hurricanes at Washington Capitals in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference second-round series. From Capital One Arena. Spencer Carbery's top-seeded Caps have dug themselves a 3-1 series hole following a pair of losses in Raleigh, as Carolina continues to pepper Logan Thompson to the tune of a 128-77 edge in shots on goal. The 'Canes have had 10 different players score their 12 series goals.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 7: Colorado Avalanche vs. Dallas Stars
programme.desc: Colorado Avalanche at Dallas Stars in Game 7 of a Western Conference first-round series. From American Airlines Center. The Avs look to snap their six-game losing streak in Game 7's, while Dallas coach Peter DeBoer tries to keep intact his perfect (8-0) record in deciding games. Colorado rallied to win Game 6 after Stars Roope Hintz and Mikko Rantanen both recorded four-point second periods.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Vegas Golden Knights at Edmonton Oilers
programme.desc: Vegas Golden Knights at Edmonton Oilers in Game 3 of a Western Conference second-round series. From Rogers Place. The Oilers skate north to Alberta with a 2-0 series lead after a hard-earned 5-4 overtime triumph in Game 2, marking their NHL-record sixth straight comeback playoff win. Connor McDavid fed Leon Draisaitl for the game-winner in the 76th minute. Jack Eichel had three assists in defeat.

programme.desc: Day 2 of the 2025 NHL Draft from the Peacock Theater in Los Angeles, Cal. Sharks, Blackhawks, Predators, Flyers and Bruins is the order to start each round, though previous trades landed new teams in some of those slots.

programme.title: Classic NHL
programme.sub-title: 2023: Florida Panthers at Vegas Golden Knights Game 5
programme.desc: From 2023: Florida Panthers at Vegas Golden Knights in Game 5 of the Stanley Cup Final. First-year coach Bruce Cassidy's Golden Knights were up 3-1, a win away from cashing Sin City's first major men's sports title. Chandler Stephenson's two goals sparked a 3-2 Game 4 win, as the center looked to add to the Cup he won with Washington over Vegas in 2018 (the Knights' inaugural season).

programme.title: Stanley Cup Final
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers
programme.desc: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers in Game 6 of the NHL championship series. From Amerant Bank Arena. Up 3-2, the Panthers are one win away from repeating as Cup champions and bringing the Sunshine State its fourth NHL title in six years. Florida foiled the Oilers 5-2 in Game 5 behind hot scorers Brad Marchand and Sam Bennett, and have an 8-0 edge in first-period scoring the last three games.

programme.title: 4 Nations Face-Off Hockey
programme.desc: Canada vs. U.S. in the championship game of the inaugural 4 Nations Face-Off featuring NHL stars. From TD Garden in Boston. Goalie Connor Hellebuyck and Team USA try to stifle Connor McDavid and Canada for a second time in six days after a 3-1 win in round-robin play. The U.S. has not won an NHL-level international tournament since the 1996 World Cup of Hockey.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 1 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Paycom Center. The top-seeded Thunder return to action after eight off days, facing interim coach David Adelman's Nuggets, who are fresh off winning a seven-game slugfest vs. the Clippers. MVP candidates Nikola Jokic and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander star in the teams first playoff meeting since 2011, when OKC got its first postseason series win since moving from Seattle.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Oklahoma City Thunder at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Denver Nuggets in Game 3 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Ball Arena. The series is knotted at 1-1 as top-seeded OKC rolls into the Mile High City for the first time since early November, following a resounding 149-106 win in Game 2. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander tallied 34 points in just 30 minutes, with his team scoring an NBA playoff record 87 first-half points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Oklahoma City Thunder at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Denver Nuggets in Game 4 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Ball Arena. A battle-tested Nuggets squad won Game 3 in overtime to take a 2-1 series lead on green, top-seeded OKC. Jamal Murray (27 pts., 4 steals) and Aaron Gordon sparked Denver while big man Nikola Jokic struggled (0-for-10 on threes, 8 turnovers). Jalen Williams' 32 points paced the Thunder.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 5 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Paycom Center. Mark Daigneault's Thunder return home tied 2-2 as they've disrupted Denver big man Nikola Jokic into more turnovers (23) than assists (22) through four games. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander had nine of his 25 points late in a 92-87 Game 4 win, in which OKC also had a 35-8 edge in bench scoring.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks in Game 2 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Madison Square Garden. The Pistons try again to end their 15-game playoff losing streak after falling 123-112 in Game 1 in the Big Apple, crumbling by 40-21 in the fourth quarter. Jalen Brunson's 34 led New York, while Karl-Anthony Towns and OG Anunoby combined for nine steals, four blocks and 46 points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 3 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. J.B. Bickerstaff's Pistons return to the Motor City as playoff winners for the first time in 17 years following a 100-94 triumph in Game 2 that knotted the series at 1-1. Cade Cunningham piled up 33 points and 12 boards in the win, while Jalen Brunson's 37 went for naught.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 4 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. J.B. Bickerstaff's Pistons trail 2-1 in the series and are a loss away from matching the league record of nine for consecutive home playoff losses, set by the 76ers (1968-71). Karl-Anthony Towns (31 points) and Jalen Brunson (30) carried New York in a 118-116 Game 3 victory.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Madison Square Garden. Tom Thibodeau's Knicks pulled out two razor-thin wins in Motown to take a 3-1 series lead, as Cade Cunningham and Detroit look to punch back at MSG. Jalen Brunson (32 points, 11 assists) and Karl-Anthony Towns (27 points) led the way in Game 4, which also saw a last-second non-call go New York's way on a three-point shot by Tim Hardaway Jr.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.sub-title: 2025: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks. From Tue. April 8, 2025.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics in Game 2 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From TD Garden. Tom Thibodeau's Knicks try to maintain the momentum of a gritty 108-105 overtime win in the opener in which they trailed Boston by 20 in the second half. OG Anunoby and Jalen Brunson scored a game-high 29 in the win, which snapped a nine-game home playoff win streak for the Celtics dating back to Game 2 of last spring's second round vs. Cleveland.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 2 of a Western Conference semifinal series. From Paycom Center. Top-seeded OKC tries to bounce back from a demoralizing 121-119 loss to the Nuggets in Game 1, which the Thunder led for the entire second half until Aaron Gordon's three in the final seconds. Nikola Jokic amassed team-highs of 42 points, 22 boards, six assists and seven turnovers.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Indiana Pacers at Milwaukee Bucks
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Milwaukee Bucks in Game 3 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Fiserv Forum. Doc Rivers' Bucks have work to do down 2-0 in this rematch from last year's first round, with six of the eight total meetings between the teams decided by double-digits. Indy never trailed in a 123-115 Game 2 win, sinking all 19 of its free throws as both sides shot well throughout.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Milwaukee Bucks at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: Milwaukee Bucks at Indiana Pacers in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Gainbridge Fieldhouse. Indiana is a win away from its second straight first-round dispatching of the Bucks after scorching the nets with 60.2 percent shooting in a 129-103 Game 4 triumph. Myles Turner had 23 points (and four blocks) to lead eight double-figure scorers for the Pacers, who sank 18 threes.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 4 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. J.B. Bickerstaff's Pistons trail 2-1 in the series and are a loss away from matching the league record of nine for consecutive home playoff losses, set by the 76ers (1968-71). Karl-Anthony Towns (31 points) and Jalen Brunson (30) carried New York in a 118-116 Game 3 victory.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 6 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. The visitors have won four of five games in this series as New York takes a 3-2 edge back to Motown, where the Pistons have lost an NBA record-tying nine straight playoff games. Third-year center Jalen Duren had nine points, 14 boards and six assists in Detroit's 106-103 Game 5 win.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets in Game 1 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Ball Arena. Ty Lue's Clippers sail into the playoffs on an eight-game win streak, boasting the third-best FG pct. defense (39.5) in the league as they battle superstar Nikola Jokic, the third player ever to average a triple-double for an NBA season. Fellow Euro Ivica Zubac patrols the paint for L.A.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets in Game 2 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Ball Arena. Denver's Russell Westbrook stung his previous Clippers mates with late clutch play in a 112-110 Game 1 overtime win. Nikola Jokic chipped in three of the Nuggets' 11 steals, to go with a game-high 29 points and 12 assists. James Harden's 32 points topped L.A., which blew a 15-point lead.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Denver Nuggets at Los Angeles Clippers
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets at Los Angeles Clippers in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Intuit Dome. L.A. is up 2-1 in a best-of-seven that began with two nail-biting finishes in Denver before the Clippers sailed to a 117-83 Game 3 win in their raucous new home in Inglewood. Nic Batum had four of L.A.'s 18 made three-pointers, to just seven for the Nuggets.

programme.desc: From 1988: Atlanta at Boston in Game 7 of the Eastern Conference semifinals. Dominique Wilkins scored 47 points for Atlanta, but the Celtics prevailed 118-116 thanks to Larry Bird's 20 fourth-quarter points.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1988: Atlanta at Boston in Game 7 of the Eastern Conference semifinals. Dominique Wilkins scored 47 points for Atlanta, but the Celtics prevailed 118-116 thanks to Larry Bird's 20 fourth-quarter points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks in Game 1 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Madison Square Garden. Fourth-year star Cade Cunningham heads the Pistons' first playoff squad in six years, and averaged 30.8 points and 8.3 assists vs. New York this season as Detroit went 2-0 at MSG. Jalen Brunson and Karl-Anthony Towns pace the Knicks in the teams' first playoff meeting since 1992.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks in Game 2 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Madison Square Garden. The Pistons try again to end their 15-game playoff losing streak after falling 123-112 in Game 1 in the Big Apple, crumbling by 40-21 in the fourth quarter. Jalen Brunson's 34 led New York, while Karl-Anthony Towns and OG Anunoby combined for nine steals, four blocks and 46 points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 3 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. J.B. Bickerstaff's Pistons return to the Motor City as playoff winners for the first time in 17 years following a 100-94 triumph in Game 2 that knotted the series at 1-1. Cade Cunningham piled up 33 points and 12 boards in the win, while Jalen Brunson's 37 went for naught.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 4 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. J.B. Bickerstaff's Pistons trail 2-1 in the series and are a loss away from matching the league record of nine for consecutive home playoff losses, set by the 76ers (1968-71). Karl-Anthony Towns (31 points) and Jalen Brunson (30) carried New York in a 118-116 Game 3 victory.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Chase Center. Steve Kerr's Warriors are up 2-1, halfway to their eighth first-round series win in the last eight tries. Steph Curry's 36 points and nine assists fueled a 104-93 win in Game 3 as Golden State weathered an early 13-point Rockets lead, and overcame 31-percent shooting from long range.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets
programme.desc: Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets in Game 5 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Toyota Center. Steve Kerr's Warriors return to Texas with a 3-1 series edge, looking to close out the young Rockets who fell 109-106 in Game 4 despite eight threes from Fred VanVleet. Jimmy Butler's 27 points sparked Golden State in his return from injury, sinking 12-of-12 free throws.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors in Game 6 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Chase Center. Steph Curry and the veteran Dubs take a second shot at closing out youthful Houston, which held serve in Game 5 with a 131-116 home win sparked by Amen Thompson's 25 points and five steals. Golden State's starters totaled just 40 points as the Rockets built a lead as big as 31.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 7: Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets
programme.desc: Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets in Game 7 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Toyota Center. Ime Udoka's Rockets reeled off back-to-back must-wins to force this deciding contest, with the winner facing Minnesota in Round 2. Houston's Fred VanVleet has shot 18-for-27 from beyond the arc in the last three games, while Warriors star Steph Curry was 11-for-33.

programme.desc: From 2013: New York at Indiana in Game 6 of a conference semifinal series. Lance Stephenson starred for the Pacers in a seven-point win over Carmelo Anthony and New York that put them into the conference finals for the first time since 2004.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 6 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. The visitors have won four of five games in this series as New York takes a 3-2 edge back to Motown, where the Pistons have lost an NBA record-tying nine straight playoff games. Third-year center Jalen Duren had nine points, 14 boards and six assists in Detroit's 106-103 Game 5 win.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks in Game 4 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Madison Square Garden. New York's series lead is down to 2-1 after a 115-93 loss in Game 3 that drops the Knicks to 1-3 at home this postseason. Boston led wire-to-wire and shot a sizzling 50 percent from beyond the arc, with all five starters sinking a three, plus five from Payton Pritchard (23 points).

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From TD Garden. The Knicks are one win away from their first conference final in a quarter century after fending off Boston 121-113 in Game 4 behind Jalen Brunson's 39 points and 12 assists. Celtics star Jayson Tatum left with a leg injury in the final minutes after pouring in 42 points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks in Game 6 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Madison Square Garden. Down 3-2, reigning-champion Boston won't go quietly despite losing star forward Jayson Tatum to injury. Jaylen Brown, Derrick White (60 points combined) and reserve center Luke Kornet starred in a 127-102 Game 5 win, delaying New York's bid for its first Eastern final in 25 years.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 1 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. Now wearing Lakers gold, Luke Doncic tries to oust Anthony Edwards and Minnesota for a second straight postseason after willing Dallas to a 4-1 win in the 2024 West finals. Twenty years earlier was the T-Wolves' last playoff meeting with the Lakers, a 4-2 West finals loss.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 2 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. Anthony Edwards and the T-Wolves try to replicate their fine form from a 117-95 win in Game 1, the Lakers' first at home since 2012. Minnesota shot 21-for-42 from long range, including six threes from Naz Reid. Newest Laker Luka Doncic tallied 37 in defeat.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 3 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Target Center. Luka Doncic (31 points, 12 boards, 9 assists) and the Lakers clawed past the T-Wolves 94-85 in Game 2 to send the series north tied 1-1. This is the same court where Doncic (with Dallas) ended Minnesota's season last May with three road wins in the Western Conference finals.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Target Center. Chris Finch's T-Wolves have a 2-1 series edge after a spirited 13-1 closing run to take Game 3, 116-104. Fifth-year forward Jaden McDaniels scored a career playoff-high 30 points and helped clamp down on L.A.'s Luka Doncic. LeBron James tallied 38 in a losing effort.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2013: San Antonio Spurs at Miami Heat
programme.desc: From 2013: San Antonio at Miami in Game 7 of the Finals. LeBron James and the Heat closed out the stubborn Spurs to claim a second consecutive crown. James capped another MVP performance with 37 points and 12 rebounds.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Kansas State (1-2, 0-1 Big 12) at Arizona (2-0, 0-0). From Arizona Stadium. Chase Kennedy and Genesis Smith man an Arizona defense that's allowed just nine points through two games, chasing QB Avery Johnson of the visiting Wildcats. K-State arrives in Tucson looking to shed the memory of a 24-21 home loss to Army.

programme.title: IndyCar Racing
programme.desc: The 109th Running of the Indianapolis 500. From Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Robert Shwartzman is the first rookie in 43 years to start on pole, with two-time champ Takuma Sato and Pato O'Ward for company on Row 1. Kyle Larson starts 19th in his bid to become the fifth driver to complete this race and NASCAR's Coca-Cola 600 in Charlotte on the same day. Defending champ Josef Newgarden is in Row 11 alongside Penske Racing teammate Will Power after their cars were found with illegal modifications.
